text.author: Pete Cashmore
text.description: Plenty of people made their mark on 2011, but not in a good way – Pete Cashmore offers a selection
text.title: 2011: The people who ruined it

main.p: ■ TOWIE's Arg. A man so tragically stupid that he could walk into a room containing nothing but a basic office chair and a necktie and within 10 minutes he would still somehow have been overpowered, bound and gagged. And yet richer and more successful than us, and you
■ Bono. We're not sure why, we just know that he must have done SOMETHING
■ Aleksandr Orlov. Yeah, OK, we get it

■ The Krankies. Not just "too much information", so much as "information that should only ever be revealed in a sealed concrete bunker in which there is no oxygen to sustain any human life that might overhear it"
■ Whoever devised and commissioned 'OMG! With Peaches Geldof'. You know who you are. And we know that you're out there. And WE WILL FIND YOU

■Silvio Berlusconi. Could only comport himself with less sexual dignity in 2012 if he spends the entire year surfacing at random in major seaports in a transparent Perspex submarine, naked and waving with his bark-encrusted scrotum pressed up against the glass
Not because he made people feel a twinge of sympathy for Rupert Murdoch but because his stage name is "Jonnie Marbles". Deserved to go to prison just for that
■Ricky Gervais. Failed to pass our diversity awareness test (see also John Galliano, John Terry, Luis Suarez, #tramlady et al)
